intro: Isoglossa angusta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf isoglossa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Isoglossa angusta is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant traits such as succulent stems and reduced leaf surface area.
